channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison confirmed the state had surpassed its 70 per cent first dose vaccination milestone on Friday.
item.title: Victoria records 510 new COVID-19 cases and one death as state hits 70% first dose target

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Dave Rennie’s Wallabies will face the Brave Blossoms in Oita before heading to Europe for Tests against Scotland, England and Wales.
item.title: Wallabies’ spring tour schedule confirmed as Japan Test locked in

item.description: At 37, Prince Harry is now older than his mother ever was. Will this landmark birthday be the moment he makes peace with the scars of the past?
item.title: The poignant truth about living past the age of a parent’s death

item.description: Champion jockey Jamie Kah will not be able to ride until 2022 after being hit with a further two-month ban for misleading stewards.
item.title: Kah given extra two-month ban for misleading stewards

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: What further changes could be made in Victoria in the short term to alleviate lockdown stress? And when can state and international borders safely reopen?
item.title: Which restrictions could we ease next? We ask the experts

item.description: The stage feels set in a way that recalls the period before the iPhone’s first release in 2007. We’re on the cusp of something big: The face computer is coming.
item.title: Computers will conquer your face

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland has recorded one new case of COVID-19 linked to the Sunnybank cluster on Friday, as the state gears up for a major vaccination push over the weekend.
item.title: New COVID case linked to cluster before Queensland’s ‘Pfizer weekend’

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Conn
item.description: Test captain Tim Paine has declared he will be fit for the Ashes after an operation to repair a disc in his neck.
item.title: Paine declares he’ll be fit for Ashes after successful surgery

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The French expressed their outrage at America by cancelling a soiree at their Washington embassy to celebrate 240 years of friendship between the nations.
item.title: ‘Stab in the back’: Europe’s fury with Morrison and Biden over AUKUS submarine deal

item.description: The monument has been completely wrapped in silver and blue fabric as part of an installation first conceived in 1961.
item.title: ‘A big gray elephant’: Arc de Triomphe is wrapped up

item.description: After relaying a story of a dubious vaccine reaction on Twitter, the rap star has waded into a war of words on vaccines, the White House, healthcare, race, and free speech.
item.title: Jab-wary Nicki Minaj’s ‘swollen’ vaccine claims put White House on the spot

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The State Parole Authority concluded it was the best way to protect community safety and said he would be subject to stringent conditions and 24/7 electronic monitoring.
item.title: Gang rapist Mohammed Skaf to be released from prison next month

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: The upcoming Panetera Pico PC, and others like it, sit somewhere between a desktop and a laptop but come in at much lower prices.
item.title: Pocketable PCs hold their own for work and play

item.description: Ake opened the scoring against Leipzig with a powerful header in the 16th minute, netting his first goal in the Champions League and second overall for City.
item.title: ‘Maybe it was meant to be’: City star’s father dies minutes after Champions League goal

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 17, 2021

item.dc:creator: Sarah McPhee
item.description: The facility will operate at the Belmore Sports Ground car park and will offer Pfizer and AstraZeneca vaccines Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays for the next six weeks.
item.title: Sydney’s first drive-through vaccination clinic to open

item.description: A look at each team’s season in 2021 and what they need to do with their lists over the off-season.
item.title: How your AFL team went in 2021 and what they should do this off-season

item.dc:creator: Peter de Kruijff
item.description: The WA Director of Public Prosecutions has given her bleakest outlook yet, explaining the challenges facing her office as the legal system bursts at the seams.
item.title: ‘Unrelenting pressure’ on public prosecutors enhances risk for mistakes and injustice

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Regulators could set restrictions on new home loans by the end of the year as house prices surge, analysts say.
item.title: ASX down 0.8%, mortgage curbs likely by year end: Morgan Stanley

item.description: Market regulators said insurer MassMutual, which employed online trader and YouTube star Keith Gill, failed to adequately supervise his activity at the heart of the “meme stock” frenzy.
item.title: Ex-employer of GameStop saga star ‘Roaring Kitty’ fined

item.dc:creator: Damien Woolnough
item.description: Joshua Scacheri made an impact on Heidi Klum’s television show Making The Cut that will finally pay off at London Fashion Week.
item.title: The sew goes on for designer after missing out on $1 million

item.description: Michael Khedoori has taken advantage of having fewer people on the street to explore his local area by doing parkour, the sport of getting from one place to another in the fastest way possible.
item.title: ‘Up here we can social distance’: the parkour runners exploring locked-down Sydney

item.description: China watchers are gaming out worst-case scenarios if Beijing allows Evergrande’s downward spiral to continue unabated. Pressure to intervene is growing on the government as signs of financial contagion increase.
item.title: China’s nightmare Evergrande scenario is an uncontrolled crash

item.description: Critics, eyeing the pass, have signalled concerns about a gradual and ongoing erosion of civil liberties during the pandemic.
item.title: ‘Instrument of freedom’: Italy approves COVID-19 pass for all workers

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: West Australians caused the busiest event sale in Australian history, with one risky reseller taking a punt at $1000 payday despite WA’s anti-scalping laws.
item.title: Perth’s grand final ticket scramble makes history, as scalper pulled from Gumtree

item.dc:creator: Mark Stehle
item.description: Use our tool to view your extended bubble under the Victorian government’s new 10-kilometre travel limit on Melburnians.
item.title: What’s within 10km of your home in Melbourne?

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Lingering symptoms of COVID-19 rarely persist in children beyond 12 weeks, in a reassuring sign they are far less likely to suffer the debilitating effects of long COVID than adults.
item.title: Global studies on long COVID and children ‘unnecessarily worrying’, say researchers

item.description: Republicans are wrestling with how to balance their scepticism of immigration with broad public support for providing refuge to Afghans allies of the US.
item.title: Republican candidate: US should not accept Afghans who helped in war

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: At AUSMIN meetings in Washington, the Defence Minister raised the possibility of new US military bases in Australia, as well as increased troop rotations.
item.title: Peter Dutton: Australia won’t be deterred by Beijing’s ‘outbursts’ over submarines

item.dc:creator: Daniella White
item.description: An 18-year-old man has been charged over an alleged road rage attack at the testing clinic in Sydney’s west.
item.title: Man charged over alleged COVID-19 clinic road rage attack

item.description: You can buy flower and vegetable seeds everywhere from supermarkets to hardware shops but that doesn’t mean all seeds are equal.
item.title: The Mornington Peninsula farming couple putting seeds in the spotlight

item.description: The world is facing high energy prices for the foreseeable future as oil and natural gas producers resist the urge to drill again, says Chevron’s chief executive.
item.title: Big Oil boss warns of high energy prices ‘for a long time’

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: China says Australia’s nuclear submarine deal with the US and the UK “gravely undermines regional peace”. The first shipment of Moderna COVID-19 vaccines is due to arrive on Australian shores tonight.
item.title: Australia news LIVE: China reacts angrily to Australia’s nuclear submarine deal; national cabinet to discuss expansion of COVID-19 home quarantine program

item.description: Wall Street swung between gains and losses and iron ore prices slumped, dragging on the US shares of mining heavyweights BHP and Rio Tinto.
item.title: US stocks fluctuate; ASX set to open lower as iron ore price tumbles

item.description: Facebook’s security teams were expanding the tactics to do more wholesale shutdowns of coordinated groups of real-user accounts causing harm.
item.title: Facebook targets ‘coordinated social harm’ in German anti-COVID lockdown movement

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: Let go from the Wanderers academy, overlooked for the Young Socceroos, Cristian Volpato is now training under Jose Mourinho and selected for Italy’s youth team.
item.title: Cut by Wanderers but selected for Italy: How Sydney kid slipped from Australia’s grasp

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: ABC News Breakfast co-host Lisa Millar didn’t mean to make a statement by quitting the platform last week. But that’s precisely what she did.
item.title: ‘I wasn’t looking to make a fuss’: Why journalists are giving up on Twitter

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: There are no rules preventing MPs living outside their electorates, but it risks sending a very dangerous message to the local community.
item.title: Parachuting pollies into safe seats fuels political cynicism

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: In the expected event that he holds his place in the Demons side, Michael Hibberd says he will be representing a host of former teammates: the Essendon 34.
item.title: ‘We’ve got a special bond’: Hibberd playing for the Essendon 34 - and his brother

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The PM was forced to shelve a virtual Coalition party room meeting on Thursday morning after tech issues derailed his attempts to spruik the new triumvirate to his parliamentary colleagues.
item.title: Awkward AUKUS times for the PM with party room tech fail

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: The genius of JobKeeper was keeping workers linked to the employers. The new payments break that link - and too many workers choose to stay at home, and that suits too many bosses.
item.title: Farewell JobKeeper, hello JobKiller: how bosses and workers are encouraged to part ways

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: This is the incredible statistic that backs up Phil Gould’s prediction that Parramatta are still a while away from winning a premiership.
item.title: The 50-year itch: Why Panthers players want it more than Eels

item.dc:creator: Lucy Carroll
item.description: A dozen of the state’s top cardiologists were forced into isolation and multiple urgent heart procedures cancelled after two unvaccinated nurses worked while infectious with COVID-19 at a major Sydney hospital.
item.title: Unvaccinated nurses bring heart procedures to standstill in Sydney hospital

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: As Australia reaches 70 per cent first dose vaccination coverage, national cabinet will consider mandating jabs for all health workers, while Greg Hunt declares public-health measures a success.
item.title: ‘Tens of thousands of lives saved’, Hunt says as national cabinet to talk mandatory vaccines

item.description: From the soil to when and where to plant them – here’s your guide to having flowers the size of saucers by summer.
item.title: Everything you need to know about growing dahlias in your garden

item.dc:creator: Anne Summers
item.description: The misogyny that hounded the nation’s first female prime minister is laid bare in a documentary, but little seems to have changed.
item.title: I see no sign that ‘ugly Australia’ has learnt from its treatment of Gillard

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Victoria’s energy minister Lily D’Ambrosio says her state will reject electricity market changes that prop up fossil-fuel power stations, and any changes aimed at keeping the lights on must prioritise zero-emissions technologies.
item.title: ‘Drawing a line’: Victoria to oppose special payments for coal plants

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: When Ryan Papenhuyzen lit up the season opener, the Roosters fullback took it personally. His response this season shows why he’s still the game’s best player.
item.title: ‘I’m rattled’: The text that shows why Tedesco is still the benchmark

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Deeper deficits, higher debts and a longer wait for a balanced budget as a result of state’s latest lockdowns.
item.title: Latest lockdowns bring fresh finance horror for Pallas

item.description: We teach people how to treat us. If you’re being called nicknames in the workplace you need to immediately cease answering to it - and make sure there’s no truth to it.
item.title: You don’t want to be called ‘teacher’s pet’? Don’t act like one
